dt: {bc}an essential characteristic quality of something that exists
{bc}the character possessed by whatever is logically conceivable
{bc}the minimum (as of food and shelter) necessary to support life
{bc}a source or means of obtaining the necessities of life

et: Middle English, from Late Latin {it}subsistentia{/it}, from {it}subsistent-, subsistens{/it}, present participle of {it}subsistere{/it}
shortdef: the condition of remaining in existence : continuation, persistence
an essential characteristic quality of something that exists

dt: {bc}farming or a system of farming that provides all or almost all the goods required by the farm family usually without any significant surplus for sale
{bc}farming or a system of farming that produces a minimum and often inadequate return to the farmer

shortdef: farming or a system of farming that provides all or almost all the goods required by the farm family usually without any significant surplus for sale
farming or a system of farming that produces a minimum and often inadequate return to the farmer —called also subsistence agriculture

dt: {bc}a level of income that provides only enough money for basic needs

shortdef: a level of income that provides only enough money for basic needs

dt: {bc}subsisting independently of anything external to itself

shortdef: subsisting independently of anything external to itself
